name: Paris
clues: This city is known as the 'City of Light'.
It features an iconic iron tower.
funFacts: The Eiffel Tower was built in 1889.
It has over 170 museums.

name: Tokyo
clues: The most populous metropolitan area.
Famous for cherry blossoms.
funFacts: World's busiest pedestrian crossing.
More Michelin stars than anywhere.

name: New York
clues: The city that never sleeps.
Home to the Statue of Liberty.
funFacts: The first capital of the United States.
The first American chess tournament was held in New York in 1843.

name: Sydney
clues: The largest city in Australia.
Home to the Sydney Opera House.
funFacts: The Sydney Opera House has over 1,000 rooms.
The Sydney Harbour Bridge is the world's largest steel arch bridge.

name: Rio de Janeiro
clues: The second largest city in Brazil.
Home to the Christ the Redeemer statue.
funFacts: The statue of Christ the Redeemer is 98 feet tall.
The city is known for its beaches.

name: Cape Town
clues: The second most populous city in South Africa.
Home to Table Mountain.
funFacts: Table Mountain is one of the oldest mountains in the world.
The city is known for its harbor.

name: Istanbul
clues: The largest city in Turkey.
It straddles Europe and Asia.
funFacts: The city was formerly known as Byzantium and Constantinople.
The Grand Bazaar is one of the largest and oldest covered markets in the world.

name: Dubai
clues: The largest city in the United Arab Emirates.
Home to the Burj Khalifa.
funFacts: The Burj Khalifa is the tallest building in the world.
The city is known for its luxury shopping.

name: Buenos Aires
clues: The capital and largest city of Argentina.
Home to the Obelisco de Buenos Aires.
funFacts: The city is known for its tango.
The Obelisco de Buenos Aires is 67 meters tall.

name: Mumbai
clues: The largest city in India.
Home to Bollywood.
funFacts: The city has the most billionaires in India.
The city is known for its street food.

name: Bangkok
clues: The capital of Thailand.
Famous for its street markets and temples.
funFacts: The Grand Palace is a major attraction.
Bangkok has one of the longest place names in the world in Thai.

name: Moscow
clues: The capital of Russia.
Home to the Kremlin and Red Square.
funFacts: Moscow has the deepest metro station in the world.
The Kremlin is home to the Russian President.

name: Seoul
clues: The capital of South Korea.
Home to K-pop and technology giants.
funFacts: Seoul has the fastest internet speeds globally.
It is home to five UNESCO World Heritage Sites.

name: Toronto
clues: The largest city in Canada.
Home to the CN Tower.
funFacts: Toronto is one of the most multicultural cities in the world.
The CN Tower was once the tallest free-standing structure.

name: Singapore
clues: A city-state in Southeast Asia.
Home to the Marina Bay Sands Hotel.
funFacts: Singapore is known as the Garden City.
Chewing gum is banned in Singapore.

name: Barcelona
clues: The capital of Catalonia in Spain.
Famous for Gaudí architecture.
funFacts: La Sagrada Familia has been under construction since 1882.
The city has 4.5 km of beaches within the city limits.

name: Venice
clues: The 'Floating City' in Italy.
Famous for its canals and gondolas.
funFacts: Venice is built on 118 small islands connected by over 400 bridges.
There are no cars or roads in the main part of Venice.

name: Cairo
clues: The capital of Egypt.
Near the ancient Pyramids of Giza.
funFacts: Cairo is home to Al-Azhar University, one of the oldest universities in the world.
The city is nicknamed 'The City of a Thousand Minarets'.

name: Amsterdam
clues: The capital of the Netherlands.
Famous for its canals and cycling culture.
funFacts: Amsterdam has more bicycles than people.
The city has over 1,500 bridges crossing its canals.

name: Kyoto
clues: The former imperial capital of Japan.
Known for its classical Buddhist temples.
funFacts: Kyoto was spared from bombing during WWII due to its cultural significance.
The city has over 1,600 Buddhist temples and 400 Shinto shrines.

name: Mexico City
clues: The capital of Mexico at high elevation.
Built on the ruins of Tenochtitlan.
funFacts: It's sinking at a rate of about 10 inches per year.
The city has the largest number of museums in the Americas.

name: Berlin
clues: The capital of Germany.
Known for its modern architecture and art scene.
funFacts: Berlin has more bridges than Venice.
The Berlin Wall fell in 1989 after dividing the city for 28 years.

name: Marrakech
clues: A major city in Morocco.
Famous for its vibrant markets and red buildings.
funFacts: The medina of Marrakech is a UNESCO World Heritage site.
It's known as the 'Red City' due to its buildings made of red sandstone.

name: Prague
clues: The capital of the Czech Republic.
Known as the 'City of a Hundred Spires'.
funFacts: Prague Castle is the largest ancient castle complex in the world.
The Astronomical Clock in Prague was installed in 1410 and is still operational.

name: Stockholm
clues: The capital of Sweden.
Built on 14 islands connected by 57 bridges.
funFacts: The Nobel Prize ceremony is held annually in Stockholm.
The city's subway system is known as the world's longest art gallery.

name: Hong Kong
clues: A special administrative region of China.
Known for its skyline and harbor.
funFacts: Hong Kong has more skyscrapers than any other city in the world.
The name means 'Fragrant Harbor' in Cantonese.

name: Vienna
clues: The capital of Austria.
Known as the 'City of Music'.
funFacts: Vienna has been ranked as the world's most livable city multiple times.
The Wiener Schnitzel is a famous dish originating from Vienna.

name: San Francisco
clues: Famous for the Golden Gate Bridge.
Known for its steep hills and cable cars.
funFacts: The Golden Gate Bridge was the longest suspension bridge when it was completed in 1937.
The city's famous fog has its own name: Karl.

name: Jerusalem
clues: One of the oldest cities in the world.
Sacred to three major religions.
funFacts: Jerusalem has been destroyed and rebuilt at least twice.
The city has over 2,000 archaeological sites.

name: Havana
clues: The capital of Cuba.
Known for its vintage cars and colonial architecture.
funFacts: Old Havana is a UNESCO World Heritage site.
The Malecón seawall stretches for 8 km along Havana's coast.

name: Copenhagen
clues: The capital of Denmark.
Home to the Little Mermaid statue.
funFacts: Copenhagen's Tivoli Gardens is one of the oldest amusement parks in the world.
More than 50% of Copenhagen residents commute by bicycle daily.

name: Athens
clues: The capital of Greece.
Home to the ancient Acropolis.
funFacts: Athens is one of the oldest cities in the world, with a recorded history spanning over 3,400 years.
The first modern Olympic Games were held in Athens in 1896.

name: Lisbon
clues: The capital of Portugal.
Known for its hilly landscape and tram system.
funFacts: Lisbon is built on seven hills, like Rome.
The city was nearly destroyed by a massive earthquake in 1755.

name: Vancouver
clues: A coastal city in British Columbia, Canada.
Known for its stunning natural scenery.
funFacts: Vancouver has been consistently ranked as one of the most livable cities in the world.
Stanley Park is larger than New York's Central Park.

name: Zurich
clues: The largest city in Switzerland.
Known for its banking and finance sector.
funFacts: Zurich has the highest standard of living in the world.
The city has over 1,200 drinking fountains with potable water.

name: Reykjavik
clues: The northernmost capital city in the world.
Capital of Iceland, known for geothermal activity.
funFacts: Reykjavik is powered almost entirely by geothermal energy and hydropower.
During summer, the sun barely sets, and in winter, there are only about 4 hours of daylight.

name: Hanoi
clues: The capital of Vietnam.
Known for its French colonial architecture.
funFacts: Hanoi celebrated its 1,000-year anniversary in 2010.
The Old Quarter has 36 streets, each named after the goods that were traditionally sold there.

name: São Paulo
clues: The largest city in Brazil and South America.
Known for its skyscrapers and diverse population.
funFacts: São Paulo has the largest Japanese population outside of Japan.
The city hosts the world's largest gay pride parade.

name: Dublin
clues: The capital of Ireland.
Home to the Guinness Storehouse.
funFacts: Dublin's Phoenix Park is the largest enclosed urban park in Europe.
The city's O'Connell Bridge is wider than it is long.

name: New Orleans
clues: Famous for jazz music and Mardi Gras.
Known for its French and Spanish Creole architecture.
funFacts: New Orleans is built below sea level, with some areas sitting 15 feet below.
The city has more historic districts than any other city in the United States.
